Package planning.actions

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    ActionParserHelper
    This class is made to identify the type of action easily.
    AttackAction
    Planning action meaning that the bot should send some or all of it's army to fight somewhere.
    AttackActionType
    Description: This class implements the ActionType abstract class from burlap and is used to tell the planner what actions are possible to take at a givens state Why This Exists: To provide the ai planer with possible attacking actions.
    BuildAction
    An Action that involves building a structure for the bot to take.
    BuildActionType
    Description: This class implements the ActionType abstract class from burlap and is used to tell the planner what actions are possible to take at a givens state Why This Exists: To provide the ai planer with possible attacking actions.
    ExpandActionType
    A class for the expand action for AI Planning.
    ScoutActionType
    A class for the Scout action for AI Planning.
    TrainAction
    An Action that involves training a new unit.
    TrainActionType
    Description: This class implements the ActionType abstract class from burlap and is used to tell the planner what actions are possible to take at a givens state How to incorperate new options: Probably would have to restructure the AllApplicableActions function to construct all reasonable possible option combinations How to allow training of new units: copy the second if statement, swap in the new unit's name and you should be good How the training capacaty array is structures: [ workers[used, avail] , ground[used, avail], combat air[used, avail], support air[used, avail]] So, currentCapacity[0][1] is the current capacaity to train new workers (the [0]) that is currently available (the [1]).
    UpgradeAction
    This class is meant to work similar to the Train and Build Actions.
    UpgradeActionType
    Currently does nothing as UpgradeAction needs to be better definied to be useful.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    ActionParserHelper.ActionEnum
    Enum for what type of action a given action is Why this exists: So that the concrete Action class can be parsed easily.
